items.album: Vejación de la Bestia / Fosa Común
items.description: Chemical grinding black/death assault from Panamá!!!!
items.label: Dunkelheit Produktionen

items.description: Last CD of this portuguese doom band. This time with some 70s touches, but still heavy... their best album up to now.
items.label: Ragingplanet, At War With False Noise

items.description: Doom/Death from UK, with members of Gallow God. Please note that it's not whiny stuff, it has good DOOM riffs.
items.label: Weird Truth Productions

items.description: Black Metal with pagan spirit from Spain. In the vein of Taake, Immortal or Windir.
items.label: Vertebrae

items.description: Third record of this pure doom metal band from Italy. Great CD!
items.label: BloodRock Records

items.description: Debut album of this italian traditional doom metal band.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Re-issue of the 2001 comeback album of this legendary band from Norway.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Debut CD of this incredible epic doom metal band from England!!! We're so proud of having them in our Topillo Family. If you like Warning, Revelation, or Mirror of Deception, you will like this!
items.label: Topillo Records

items.description: Twisted and furious Death/Black metal. Imagine a fast-paced, extreme sounding version of Voivod's mid-career albums with an atmosphere similar to last Bloody Sign CD. Killer!
items.label: Necroshrine Records

items.description: Cult 1992 demo of this hungarian crossover band. Recommended for freaks of hungarian crossover bands, goulash, etc!
items.label: Metal Ör Die Records

items.description: Compilation CD of Misty Grey, including their EP "The Third Man" and their demo "Demon". A bit rawer than the debut CD but still great dooooom.
items.label: Metal Ör Die Records

items.description: Traditional doom metal with creepy female vocals from Madrid. For fans of Pentagram, Witchfinder General or Reino Ermitaño. Arguably, the best doom album ever recorded in Spain.
items.label: Out of the Past, Vertebrae, Topillo Records

items.description: Two long songs by this dark and heavy band. Horror doom from the South of England.
items.label: At War With False Noise

items.description: First full-length of this punkish doom metal band from Rome.
items.label: BloodRock Records

items.description: Debut album of this great band from Bulgaria! Powerful true doom sound, a la Reverend Bizarre.
items.label: Solitude Productions

items.description: Finally available the second full-length of these death metal maniacs from Cuenca (Spain). If you like your Death Metal being rooted in the ancient sounds, try this.
items.label: Equinox Discos

items.description: Fucking great funeral doom album of these czechs. Church organ worshipping a la Skepticism, etc.
items.label: Moscow Funeral League / Solitude Productions

items.description: 10th anniversary reissue of Forced Entry, the debut album of the Heavy Metal band RAM. In short words: pounding metal a la Judas Priest!
items.label: Bloody Productions

items.description: Although Rote Mare used to be a one-man project, now it's a full true doom band. Twisted and demented stuff from Australia.
items.label: Rotedoom Records

items.description: Interesting band from the minds behind Insulters. Here they play a mix of Black/Death/Rock n roll with some doomy touches.
items.label: Equinox Discos

items.description: Funeral doom classic, I'm pretty sure most of you are familiar with this album.
items.label: Weird Truth Productions
